meanings.definition: A toll or fee paid for grinding grain at a mill.
meanings.sent1: The multures at the mill were used to cover the cost of grinding grain.
meanings.sent2: Farmers had to pay multures to have their grain processed at the mill.
meanings.sent3: The multures seemed like tiny coins for the service of grain grinding.
meanings.sent4: The multures acted as gatekeepers, allowing only grain to pass through for a price.
meanings.sent5: The sound of multures clinking together echoed in the bustling mill.

meanings.definition: The right to collect such tolls.
meanings.sent1: The owner of the mill held the multures for all grain brought in.
meanings.sent2: Having the multures meant having control over the milling process.
meanings.sent3: It felt empowering to hold the multures and dictate the tolls.
meanings.sent4: The multures were like keys to unlocking the profits of the mill.
meanings.sent5: With the multures in hand, one could determine the fate of the grain.

meanings.definition: The act of grinding grain at a mill.
meanings.sent1: The multures of the mill kept the community supplied with flour.
meanings.sent2: Witnessing the multures in action was a fascinating process.
meanings.sent3: The multures danced around the millstones, turning grain into flour.
meanings.sent4: In the rhythmic motion of the multures, grain transformed into sustenance.
meanings.sent5: The multures tirelessly worked to produce the essential flour for all.
